meanings.definition: To take great pleasure or delight in something.
meanings.sent1: The children were reveling in the colorful fireworks display.
meanings.sent2: She was reveling in the beauty of the sunset.
meanings.sent3: The puppy was reveling in the joy of chasing its tail.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was reveling in the warmth of his kind words.
meanings.sent5: The artist was reveling in the creative process, lost in a world of colors and shapes.

meanings.definition: To engage in lively and noisy festivities or celebrations.
meanings.sent1: The town was reveling in the excitement of the annual parade.
meanings.sent2: They were reveling in the music and dancing at the party.
meanings.sent3: The group of friends was reveling in the laughter and jokes shared around the bonfire.
meanings.sent4: The stadium was reveling in the cheers and applause of the enthusiastic crowd.
meanings.sent5: The city was reveling in the lights and sounds of the New Year's Eve celebration.
